intro: Couepia spicata, commonly known as the spiny nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom at night. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, and it is often found in dry, disturbed habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is generally avoided by livestock and humans.
